commitResults.messageTitle: Convert for loops into Streams
commitResults.messageBody: There are several methods that contain for loops.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions to test code
commitResults.messageBody:
No checks are done to ensure that a response is formed when user enters input or that
a file path exists

Asserting that file path exists ensures that creating a File object with the file path will not
throw an error. Asserting that the response is not an empty String ensures that there is no
error in parsing user commands and having Duke respond to the command.

Using assertions is desirable because it can indicate any errors made by the coder.

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskList class: extract a method checkTaskNumValidity
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList methods (e.g. markTask, unmarkTask, deleteTask) have some common
behaviours.

The common behaviors across taskList methods cause code duplication.

Extracting the common behavior into a method allows us to use the same
method for checking the validity of a task number when new commands are added.

Let's pull up behaviors common to all methods into a new private method called
checkTaskNumValidity.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change Duke to deal with exceptions concerning date-time
commitResults.messageBody:
AddDeadlineCommand, AddEventCommand, AddTodoCommand is unable to deal with exceptions
regarding date-time.

Create an InvalidDateTimeException and InvalidTaskDescription Exception. All methods that involve
creating Deadlines and Events now check if the date-time input by the user is in the correct format,
verify that the start date is before the end date and that there are no missing date or time inputs.

Now Duke will feedback to the user if there is a date-time related exception.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #1 from cyiting/branch-a-assertions
Merge branch 'branch-a-codequality'
Merge branch 'branch-a-streams'
Create Tag, EmptyTag, TagList classes to allow users to tag their tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Implementation of tagging is not done.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality for the user to add a tag to a task when creating it
commitResults.messageBody:
The tasks in the task list cannot be categorised. This functionality allows users to categorise their
tasks by the tag name.

Adding an attribute of type Tag to the abstract class Task allows the tag to be displayed when the
tasks are listed and the users are now able to get a list of all the tasks under the same tag.

and listing tasks tagged to a keyword, variable arguments allow them to be
combined into a class.
